Privacy Policy McDonalds employees review and complaint–bad customer service and rude behavior towards customers. By Aman McDonalds has the rudest employees!
I went to this McDonald’s restaurant located on El Camino Real in Sunnyvale and had the worst cashier you could possible imagine behind the register. I greeted this McDonald’s sking,“how are you doing?”. No reply from him.“What can I get you?”is what he says. That’s fine. He is doing his duty.
My order was a no. 6 Club Sandwich, crispy and just the sandwich no meal, also 4 McNuggets, just the nuggets. First he can’t find where the nuggets are, he then asks his manager or someone where to find the nuggets in the register. He then asks me, how many, I say 4.
He then talks to his manager and says he can’t give 4 to me. The manager says 6 is the min. I said that’s fine, give me 6. Then he adds it as a meal, instead of just the nuggets. I told him just the nuggets not the meal. He puts his face as if I gave him a wrong order and changes the order and says around $10 is my bill.
I said it is around 4 for the sandwich and 3 for the nuggets how come my bill is $10. I didn’t even pay by that time. The over zealous waiters inside placedmy order out on the counter even before I paid. This guy has added a meal on my sandwich as well and says it is $6 for the sandwich combo, which I have mentioned clearly in the beginning just the sandwich. He is like what and gives me a pretty bad look and starts all over again.
Your Ad Here
Mean while the waitress from inside asks him what’s happening, he from out of this world blames everything on me with a single line,“this guy is unable to make up his mind”. I was shocked and so pissed off that I wanted to kick his behind right there or atleast make a scene by complaining about him.
Somethings stopped me from doing that::
1)It was lunch time and there were lots of people waiting. 2)He is one of those employees who is working really hard for peanuts, I didn’t want to get him fired. 3)I tried to understand him dealing with so many crazy customers.
But I was really pissed off, my order was crystal clear, he messed it up and blamed it on me. I am not going to give my order next time to this guy or I will stop going to that particular McDonald’s altogether.

I ordered a Quarter Pounder, sandwich only, at your drive through window. When the cashier told at the next window told me the total was nearly $5, I said there must be a mistake, this normally runs no more than $3.50 or so. Can you double check the amount for a quarter pounder only? After repeating the phrase“quarter pounder only”about 3-4 times to try to get through to the guy, after repeatedly being told that that was the correct price. He eventually said that they raised the prices. I said by over $1.50, let me see the receipt. After about 5 minutes I finally got the receipt to find it said“double”quarter pounder. Then I told the cashier, thats why, the receipt says double quarter pounder. He still didn’t seem to understand. I repeated for a 4th or 5th time that I ordered a regular quarter pounder. Finally, I got the manager and after another 5-10 minutes I was finally refunded the money and given the correct order. I didn’t even get an apology. I won’t be back to your establishment ever again and I will tell all of my friends, family, and business associates–there’s a Carl’s Jr. next door and they never seem to mix up the orders.
